title: THE ULTIMATE TRACTOR TIRE GUIDE: TREAD PATTERN OPTIONS!

tasks.task: Evaluate tractor tire tread patterns for specific applications.
subtasks: Discuss the R1 Ag style tire's V-shaped pattern and traditional use in farming.
Explain the R4 industrial style tire's thicker, flatter bars and applications in various machinery.
Describe the R3 turf tire's design for lawnmowers, golf courses, and floatation.
Introduce the HDAP (Heavy Duty All Purpose) tire as a hybrid with multiple applications.
Highlight the Carlisle VersaTurf as a premium radial tire option for larger tractors.

tasks.task: Compare prices and construction of the discussed tires.
subtasks: Note the same size (26-12-12) and list price similarities of R1, R3, and HDAP tires.
Explain the higher cost of radial tires like the VersaTurf due to construction differences.
Differentiate between radial (VersaTurf) and bias (R1, R3, HDAP) tire construction.

tasks.task: Assess lawn mowing performance of various tire types.
subtasks: Rank tires from best to worst for lawns: radial (VersaTurf) > HDAP > R3/R1.
Explain why aggressive tires (R1) damage lawns and are unsuitable for frequent use.

tasks.task: Evaluate tire performance in snow and ice.
subtasks: Rank tires for snow/ice performance: radial (VersaTurf) > HDAP > R3 > R4.
Highlight power and traction as critical factors in severe weather conditions.
Rank tires for paved surfaces: radial (VersaTurf) > HDAP/R3 ≈ R1/R4.
Discuss the trade-off between comfort and wear resistance on hard surfaces.

tasks.task: Evaluate tires for dirt and mud.
subtasks: Rank tires for dirt/mud performance: R1 > HDAP > radial > R4.
Explain the advantages of R1's pattern for muddy conditions and self-cleaning cleats.
